title: Jack Daniel's Label Fonts
content:
I was out voted so now I am going as a dog for a Halloween costume party. I wanted to spice up the outfit a bit and make into a dirty dog. My hope is to recreate a Jack Daniel's label with a dog twist called, Jack Spaniel's. As in a springer spaniel. Instead of 80 proof, it will be 80 woof. You get the idea. The bottle will be filled with ice tea.

There are what I believe to be, six different font types on this label. Any help is much appreciated.

1- Every drop. . .  
2- Sour Mash: Franklin Gothic  
3- Whiskey  
4- Jack Daniel Distillery: Clarendon Bold  
5- 40% ALC BY VOL. . .  
6- Here at the Jack Daniel. . .

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [JD label fonts.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315072435/http:/typophile.com/files/JD%20label%20fonts.png) | 255.07 KB |
author: umlautthoni

comments.content: 4- Jack Daniel Distillery: Clarendon Bold, perhaps?
3- Century I believe, but from which foundry I'm not sure...
5- Looks very close to Univers 320 Light Condensed but the R's tail on the label has more of a curve at the end, and the parenthesis is different.

1- Monotype Grotesque [MT] Bold Extended -- EXCEPT it looks slightly heavier and terminals on the C are not angled as those on the JD label. HOWEVER, I noticed Monotype Grotesque [MT] Bold (not extended) has a C like the one on the label. Is the JD font an earlier version of Monotype's or is it another grotesque altogether? Why are the C's terminals differently fashioned for normal and extended?
I wonder if it was JD's attempt at customizing the look and feel of their label?

1- [Knockout HTF](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315072435/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/knockout/overview) 53 Heavyweight  
5- [Knockout HTF](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315072435/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/knockout/overview) 28 junior Featherweight  
6- [Mrs Eaves EM](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315072435/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/mrs-eaves-ot) Bold

Bonus  
Jack Daniel's: [Jasper](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315072435/http:/www.segura-inc.com/portfolio/393) by Carlos Segura Inc.  
Tenessee: [Lynchburg Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315072435/http:/www.segura-inc.com/portfolio/393) by Carlos Segura Inc.
Ryuk has indeed correctly solved 1, 5 and 6. Now it's SO obvious!
